newsitem.title: JAPAN: TOCOM August palladium surges by daily limit.
newsitem.headline: TOCOM August palladium surges by daily limit.

text.p: August palladium futures on the Tokyo Commodity Exchange (TOCOM) surged by their 24 yen per gram daily limit in the afternoon session on Monday, following sharp gains for the spot June contract and a surge in spot palladium prices, traders said.
The spot June palladium, which has no daily price limit, rose by 104 yen per gram to a record high of 872 yen.
The August was up by its limit of 24 yen at 686 yen, while benchmark April was up 16 yen at 581 yen.

"The surge in spot palladium prices prompted private investors to cover their massive short positions, while the higher spot prices compared with yen-based futures made it almost impossible for traders to conduct arbitrage trade," one trader said.
Traders were worried about the extreme tightness of the spot palladium market because Russia has suspended sales for more than five months.
